reviews.review_msg: Took this course in distance format. He gave very very very tough exams especially the final exam. Exams are irrelevant to both the textbook and his notes. I survived because we have an easy marker. Midterm avg was like 62% and I think he scaled the final exam a lot . Not recommend this prof for a first year prof

Glyn loves to talk about his research which I found super interesting. Course content was simple enough and interesting, but the lab content was really tough, so give yourself lots of time to study for that! Lectures posted online so was okay missing some lectures, but emphasizes stuff on exams so it's helpful to attend. By and large loved it!

Lectures give you the general gist. Textbook is optional but still useful. Overall a course on the harder side due to a small number of people who are actually interested in GEOLOGY. It's not hard if you're either interested or study hard. The reason it's hard for the majority is prob b/c they expect to learn the basics and not the mechanisms.
awesome professor! very passionate and helpful. he was very clear with what would be on midterm and final. pay attention and you are good to go. always there for help. i recommend his class

I took this course as my 2nd elective course. Don`t take this course, if you dont need it.completly useless.it is even harder than any 4th year Ensc course.Professor thinks he is teaching quantum physics and he is trying too hard to show that the course is really Important . Just don't take this course if you don't need it.trust me

Awesome prof.  Very passionate about the subject and makes you want to know more!  He is energetic in lecture and a very intelligent dude.  Always available for help, answers questions thoroughly and in a way you can understand!  I would take another class with him in a second.

great prof. very helpful and he tries to help whenever he can. since the midterm mark was really low, he gave students the option to combine the midterm percentile with the final... not many profs will give a second chance like he does

absolutely amazing prof. he was very enthusiastic and clear in lectures. this is certainly not a course you can breeze through unless you took geology in highschool but both himself and the ta's are very helpful. i recommend taking any course with this guy because he doesnt bs you and he's also really friendly
He is very interested in what he teaches and very willing to explain things you do not understand. His midterm will be the end of your mark though.

Good prof. Don't take Easc101 thinking it's an easy course. It's not. i got pwned. The course itself is boring and useless if you arent pursuring geology. I got a C in this class. The labs were 80% guesswork imo. I wouldnt recommend anyone to take this course. 104 may be more interesting however.
Good teacher but the exams are very hard.  You have to memorize the whole textbook to do well on the midterm and final.
GOOD

HE was really boring. This course can be really difficult especially if you don't have interest in it. So don't take this course if you don't have interest. Also do the weekly readings. Falling behind is no fun.

EASC 101: Very hard course, especially if you're not interested in it/an arts student and not a science person. Very technical, everything is MEMORIZATION, and final is cummulative. Labs are really tough too, especially lab midterms/finals. Labs are absolutely mandatory or you get 0 for participation that day, and there is alab quiz during each lab
He doesn't really teach first year, so we were lucky to have him. Not pedantic. Bit easy because it's a course for arts students too.
fun classes and easy materials

Great prof and really interesting lectures! If you study a good deal for tests, you'll do fine. He'd share personal stories relating to topics which kept it interesting. The one time he yelled at that student in lecture, the student was being so annoying and totally deserved it!!!! Good prof.

Clearly really cares about her students and is very passionate about the material. The tests are all lecture based and she provides in-depth study materials to help students do well. Would happily take more of her classes
Best university instructor I've ever had!

Cindy is a pretty nice professor. In my opinion her exams were fair, but it requires a LOT of memorization. You need to be able to remember almost all details from her slides. If you don't have a strong memory, do not take the class! This class seems a bit too much for a 100 level course. Lots of people failed her exams.

Cindy is a fun prof, the course material is interesting. Her grading is extremely critical, I would not remotely recommend this class to anyone who has the slightest issue with memorization. offers plenty of bonus marks though. Just found myself getting frustrated over how poorly I was doing on these exams compared to my other science classes.
Very kind professor that gives you a lot of bonus points. Also removes questions if class average is low. Would recommend to future students looking for a breadth science class to take.

Cindy is very nice and her lectures are fun. The only issue is how it's become nearly Impossible to do good on her tests. You can attend every single lecture, spend weeks studying and you will still get 60%. I've had an easier time with math and chem classes. way too hard for a first year class I would not recommend unless you want to cry.

I took this course as a GPA booster elective and it was the biggest mistake Ive made, I probably scored better in my 4 credit stats course. Cindy is okay but the course has 4 extremely hard and time constraint exams which account for 80%. If you dont want to spend studying hours on end for a 101 course, stay clear of her and this course.

Cindy is fine and as well is the course but her tests are too long for the mere 50 minutes given to us. 1 Lab and 2 quizzes every week with 4 tough and extremely time constrained tests accounting for 20% each. Grading is also tough. Took it as an elective for an easy grade, ended up crying. Not recommended.
Online courses is awful. The test has really limited time to do. It is impossible to do it within 50 mins (30 MCQs + 15 short Qs). Quizzes and lab every week....
Test is extremely long for short period of time . Tough grader. Lab exercises is ok but they only account for 10% with 3 very long test, each account for 30%

Cindy has such a boring and slow voice it makes you fall asleep and retain no info. I took this class online and she is good at explaining things if you can pay attention. 90% of your grade is tests and 10% labs which take 3+ hours. The tests are long (30 MC and 15 short answer) and are impossible to get a good grade based off her marking.

I didn't find the course very hard but the average was really low for an intro class. Cindy was good, in office hours was pretty helpful as well. She cared about the students. But the tests left everyone a little rushed for time. Overall a solid course and very good prof as long as you do your part.

I'm not sure how this class is in person, but avoid it if you are taking it online. The tests are extremely hard because you have very little time and they are all "applied knowledge" questions. Lectures were pretty boring and confusing because her explanations are super wordy. Would not recommend

103 went great, so I decided to take 101 with Cindy. It was a mistake. The exams had too many questions to finish within 50 mins. If you don't know the answer to a question as soon as you read it, consider it a lost mark. Assignment marking is harsh and nit-picky. Heed other comments and don't take this course unless you absolutely need it.

I took it when all courses got switched to online halfway through due to Covid-19 and it got so much easier online. The first half of the course was hard and the lab exam and midterm were also very hard. Make sure you know all the properties of every single mineral and rock.
Very nice and lectures are easy to follow. Everything you need to know are in the notes so the text is not necessary.
Cindy is alright but so much of what you learn in this class is memorization and she's happy to ding you where you're not spitting off the lecture slides.
She is passionate about the class but does a terrible job preparing you for the exams. I don't recommend taking this class.

She has been one of my favorite profs. She is very clear in her lectures and her expectations. I didn't do any readings, but the lectures and lecture notes (not posted online) and extremely helpful. The labs aren't too hard but you need to study a loooot for lab midterms. I highly recommend taking this with her if you put in the work.

Omg, I read the things here thinking she would be good. She is completely the opposite for academics at least. Sure she is nice and friendly as well as passionate and helpful. But my lord her tests and especially final were so bad 30/85 failed and she didn't even curve it. AVOID her does not prep you for final and tells you the wrong test content!
she makes the course very hard and she expects too much from students and its a 100 level course. NEVER TAKING ANY COURSE WITH HER.

She expects you to know A LOT. Memorize EVERYTHING for the first midterm. Her mineral and rock lab exam was really hard, there was a TON to memorize as well. Second lab exam is way easier. Final tbd... I am expecting the worst considering how hight of expectations she has for a first year course... :(

ok whoever said shes hot needs their eyes checked! she looks like a 40 yr old lady =P she is nice but she barley took part or was around during labs. Her exams were moderately hard and lectures were dry as heck. Not a bad prof, but expect A LOT of work needed for this class there and at home!
Fantastic lab instructor!!  Cindy was patient and helped out so much.  Her help made the labs so much less stressful.  Cindy's explanations were very clear and helped sooo much for exam!!

I absolutely adore Cindy! She was an awesome lab instructor. The labs were somewhat difficult and you need to study A LOT for the lab midterm/final. She was extremely helpful and had a good sense of humour! She was also pregnant while teaching in the Spring 2009 semester! Congrats Cindy (if you ever read this) xD

Excellent lab instructor. Very clear instructions during lab and very willing to help. Easily approachable and a very lenient marker. Lab midterm and final were very fair. If you put the effort into this, it will definitely reflect on your mark. =)

A great lab instructor! Really makes the material very clear & explains things carefully. Offers TONS of office/lab time so you can study & catch up. A very fair marker & a good person, she cracks jokes in lab and will chat with you too. Definitely one of the best I've had in many years of school! I will take a course with her again in a flash.

Cindy's the lab instructor, but she's taught this course before apparently. Wow, she's by far the best instructor I've had through 3 yrs of school. She's sooo organized, crystal clear in her expectations and instruction. She's also very friendly and obviously loves what she does. I would definetly take a course with her again.

Her EASC 101 lectures were very straightforward and interesting, but if you really wanna pass her version of this class you gotta prep hard because you're graded on 7 things total. It's living on the razor's edge but if you have other classes that are homework heavy it can be pretty nice. In all, chill & enjoyable teacher but not an unalloyed good.

Nice prof and helpful, but the exams are ridiculous. The content is straight-forward, but you'll need to write down every word that Robbie says and know every detail from the textbook because silly, specific questions will be on the exam. On top of that, exams are marked very harshly.

The course itself is heavy but Robbie is knowledgeable, consistent, and clear in her explanations. She has high expectations and marks hard as a result. Exams can be quite challenging, but are still fair & require a lot of detail. Lab exams are mostly based on lecture material. Would not suggest her class if you're not prepared to study thoroughly.

Robbie is clearly engaged and knowledgable in the subject, however her lectures cover too much material for a first year course. Her tests require in depth knowledge of all material covered, including facts that may not have seemed relevant in lecture. Would not suggest taking this class if you're not interested in pursuing Earth Science.

She's very caring and nice. As an Arts student, I was afraid of this course in the beginning, but Robbie made EASC so interesting and engaging! Loved the rock labs. Frank (TA) was quite helpful. The midterm and final (exams are mostly based on lecture, so attend them) are not hard at all if you spend enough time and effort.

don't take this course!! she makes a huge deal about having to attend lecture but nothing I copied in class I didn't find the textbook. Exam questions are ridiculous in that just reading the textbook or her notes isn't enough, extensive knowledge + interest is required if you want to pass! Class average was 40% for first exam & 60 for second

Can easily tell that she's into the material, will answer ANY geology questions you have, even if it's unrelated to the course. Really chill, and even threw in some jokes in the final. Made me wanna continue in geology.

She's very nice, and very interested in teaching students the course content. She expects a lot of the students though, and in order to do well you must study a lot. Personally, I had to read every chapter she assigned, as she does not go over everything in her lectures. Work hard and you'll get a good mark easily

Overall the class was alright, alot of work tho, roughly 20 chapters for final but they're short. MT I found was difficult but the final was easy IMO. Best piece of advise is get Cindy as your TA, she`s awesome and will help you all the way. Really cared for her students and super fun! Overall I would recommend this class but b prepared to work :)

She sucks at teaching in general. She repeats everything in the txtbk and final exam is everything from the beginning. Her exams have questions from the lectures and also they are very detailed. She is a horrible teacher. DONT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER.
Not bad, but material for course was dry. Tests are slightly on the hard side and lectures are boring. Labs can be fun but are very long overall shes an ok prof not bad not good.

Wonderful prof! Uses PP slides during lectures but doesn't post them online, so be prepared to do a lot of note taking. Clearly passionate about her subject, makes class very enjoyable and interesting! Need to memorize a lot of content for exams, but cheat sheet is allowed. Rock-identifying labs can be challenging.
Robbie was great - I agree with others, you have to do the work! But there were no really big surprises on the exams, and we did get to use cheat sheets!!
LOOOOOOOOOVE herrrrrr one of the best prof ive had so far

Enthusiastic and knowledgeable prof that is a great addition to the school. I didn't know about EASC before taking this class and it was really interesting! Lets you use cheat-sheets on the exams... but you STILL need to study & read the text, so don't slack off! Lots of interesting stuff in this class and Robbie presents it clearly & in a fun way!
Harsh marker!two thumbs down.

Robbie is so great :) i had so much fun in her class.. she's very helpfull and available all the time.. although the material was too much but she made easy and marked the exams very fairly.. she's really nice :)

Not clear about expectations and the midterm was mostly complex questions about concepts she didn't even understand fully. Her final was much better for a 100 level class. Still, her attitude was very strict and unhelpful. For a 100 level course she honestly expected everyone to read the entire 19 chapter book and take notes on it. Avoid.

Terrible professor. Doesn't post lectures online for a course that is strictly memorization of information and figures. Average for the midterm is 50% but there is no scaling? What kind of 100 level course is this? AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Pretty useless overall. Every time she went over something in lecture and someone asked a question about it, she would just repeat what she said earlier and to take a look at the book. Questions didn't feel encouraged during class at all. She also asks pretty tough questions for how briefly she goes over topics in class.

She seemed like she didnt want to be teaching, especially this class. I think she would be better in research or something that does not require much contact with students. It was difficult course to get a good grade in even though the material was not that complicated. Would not recommend taking any of her classes.

By far the worst prof I have had. She often had no idea what she was talking about and confused everyone when she would try to explain herself. She did not respond well to questions and always avoided giving clear answers. Avoid this class like the plague. Never take a class with Marit. Labs were excellent and I owe my passing grade to the TA's.

Such inconsistency. He used lecture slides from the course's old professor and would regularly state how he disagreed with the info contained in them. He also stated that he disagreed with the textbook and the lab manual on many occasions, so it was confusing in terms of what content to remember and what questions he would ask. Do not take with him

Orlando is a very good prof who is easily accessible outside of class. This course is content heavy, so be careful of that and don't fall behind! The lab component of this course can be difficult, but if you put in some extra effort, you should do just fine. His lecture slides are very well done, and are easy to follow and study from.
Orlando is a super nice prof, but this class is so much damn work! There is so much to memorize...
Best prof.
He is super interested in the topics and is a very personable and approachable person!
